questions.prompt: In BG 7.1, what does Krishna ask Arjuna to do?
choices: Hear about knowledge; completely surrender to Krishna
questions.feedback: Krishna reveals the knowledge of self and His divine nature.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.2, what is the promise to one who understands this knowledge?
choices: Complete knowledge; nothing remains to be known
questions.feedback: Full understanding eliminates all doubt and leads to completeness.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.3, what is the rarity of those who can understand Krishna's nature?
choices: Among thousands of humans, few endeavor for perfection; among those, few know me
questions.feedback: Self-realization is the rarest achievement among living beings.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.4 teach about Krishna's energies?
choices: My energy is divided into eight aspects; all beings manifest through these
questions.feedback: The Lord manifests the material and spiritual worlds through His energies.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.5, what is the relationship between matter and the living entity?
choices: The material energy is inferior; the living entities are my superior energy
questions.feedback: The spiritual nature of the soul is higher than the material world.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.6, what is the origin of all beings?
choices: I am the source of all; all emanates from me; I am the origin
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate source and sustainer of all existence.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.7 teach about relationships and attachments?
choices: I am the taste in water, the light in the sun; all comes from me
questions.feedback: The Divine is the essence behind all manifestations of life and nature.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.8, what does Krishna identify as His living energy?
choices: The sound vibration OM; I am the spiritual energy
questions.feedback: The sacred sound OM represents Krishna's transcendental potency.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.9, what are examples of Krishna being the original of all?
choices: He is only in the temple
I am the fragrance in water, the heat in fire, and the life in all
questions.feedback: Krishna is perceptible through His intimate presence in all creation.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.10 teach about Krishna's powers?
choices: The force of my energy is the essence of all; everything rests on my potency
questions.feedback: Krishna's energy is the fundamental basis of all material and spiritual existence.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.11, what types of people approach Krishna?
choices: The righteous seek me, while the wicked seek material gains
questions.feedback: Different motivations determine how one approaches the Divine.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.12, what kinds of worship does Krishna recognize?
choices: The wise worship me in my various forms
questions.feedback: Krishna accepts devotion in whatever form it is offered sincerely.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.13 teach about those attached to material desires?
choices: They worship the demigods; I grant them specific blessings, but they attain limited results
questions.feedback: Those caught in material desires achieve only temporary material rewards.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.14, who can attain Krishna consciousness?
choices: Those who surrender unto me with full faith; they are rare
questions.feedback: Perfect surrender requires unwavering faith and devotion.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.15, what types of fools are mentioned?
choices: Those who know not my transcendental nature; they waste precious life
questions.feedback: Ignoring Krishna's nature is the greatest folly and waste of human life.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.16 teach about approaching Krishna?
choices: Four types of fortunate people approach me: the distressed, the curious, the seeker of wealth, and the wise
questions.feedback: Different circumstances can lead to sincere seeking of the Divine.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.17, among those who approach Krishna, who is dearest to Him?
choices: The wise who serve me with single-pointed devotion
questions.feedback: The sincere devotee devoted to Krishna alone is most beloved.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.18-19, who are truly wise according to Krishna?
choices: At the end of many births, the wise know me as all that is; they surrender unto me
questions.feedback: True wisdom culminates in surrender to the Supreme.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.20 teach about those whose minds are distracted?
choices: Those attracted to other demigods lose focus on me and cannot obtain lasting peace
questions.feedback: Divided attention prevents full attainment of the highest goal.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.21, what happens when Krishna grants desires to other deities' worshippers?
choices: I grant them their desires, but they eventually return to this world
questions.feedback: Material desires may be fulfilled but lead only to temporary satisfaction.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.23, what awaits those who worship other deities with temporary material goals?
choices: They achieve temporary results and eventually return to the cycle of birth and death
questions.feedback: Limited worship brings limited and temporary results.

questions.prompt: What does BG 7.24 teach about how Krishna appears to different worshippers?
choices: He appears the same to all
I appear according to the faith and consciousness of the worshipper
questions.feedback: One's own consciousness shapes what one perceives of the Divine.

questions.prompt: According to BG 7.25, why do foolish people mistake Krishna for a mortal?
choices: It is obvious Krishna is mortal
They cannot understand my transcendental nature; they think I am merely human
questions.feedback: Ignorance of Krishna's divine nature is the cause of this delusion.

questions.prompt: In BG 7.26, what does Krishna know?
choices: All that is, was, and will be; all secrets and desires
questions.feedback: Krishna's omniscience encompasses all of past, present, and future.

questions.prompt: What is the main message of Chapter 7?
choices: I am the source of all; surrender unto me; only the wise know this
questions.feedback: Complete knowledge culminates in whole-hearted surrender to the Supreme.
